intro: Pimelea ligustrina subsp. hypericina, commonly known as the Christmas Bush, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and dry sclerophyllous forests. The subspecies is distinguished by its more intense yellow flower color compared to other Pimelea species.
